channel.title: Decision Theory on Adam Jermyn
channel.description: Recent content in Decision Theory on Adam Jermyn

item.title: Humans do acausal coordination all the time
item.description: (Cross-posted from the AI Alignment Forum) I used to think that acausal coordination was a weird thing that AI’s might do in the future, but that they certainly wouldn’t learn from looking at human behavior. I don’t believe that anymore, and think there are lots of examples of acausal coordination in everyday life. Examples people do Voting The political science argument against voting goes: The probability that my vote tilts the election is tiny, so the expected value to me is tiny, so it’s not worth my time to vote.
